newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Cricket-S.Lankans miss world records.
newsitem.headline: Cricket-S.Lankans miss world records.

text.p: Sri Lankan batsmen Sanath Jayasuriya and Roshan Mahanama failed to rewrite record books when they were both out shortly after play began on the final day of the first test against India in Colombo on Wednesday.

Jayasuriya added only 14 runs to his overnight total of 326 before he was caught at silly point by Saurav Gangully off the bowling of Rajesh Chauhan. His tally left him 35 runs shy of Brian Lara's record 375 set for the West Indies against England in Antigua three years ago.
The 28-year-old left hander's total of 340 put him in fourth spot on the list of highest individual scores, behind Lara, Gary Sobers (365) and Len Hutton (364).
Jayasuriya's partner for two days, Mahamana was out earlier for an individual best score of 225, trapped leg before wicket by Anil Kumble.

The two batsmen created a record partnership of 576 for any wicket in Test cricket, but fell short by just one run of equalling the all-time partnership record of 577 for first-class matches set by V.S.Hazare and Gul Mohammed for Baroda against Holkar in 1946-47.
